question:
District category contains Senior Living Community, and Dormitory District.
Supermarkets category contains Vons, and Stop & Shop.
Product category contains Buns, and Half-and-half.
Ingredient category contains Gelatin, and Pickles.
The number of each Buns 's Gelatin equals 13.
The number of each Senior Living Community 's Vons equals 1 more than each Stop & Shop 's Buns.
The number of each Stop & Shop 's Half-and-half equals each Vons 's Product.
The number of each Half-and-half 's Gelatin equals the difference of each Buns 's Pickles and each Half-and-half 's Pickles.
The number of each Vons 's Buns equals the difference of each Buns 's Pickles and each Half-and-half 's Ingredient.
The number of each Vons 's Half-and-half equals 7 times each Buns 's Pickles.
The number of each Buns 's Pickles equals 2.
The number of each Stop & Shop 's Buns equals 13.
The number of each Dormitory District 's Stop & Shop equals each Vons 's Ingredient.
The number of each Half-and-half 's Pickles equals 17.
How many Ingredient does Vons have?
solution:
Define each Half-and-half 's Pickles as a; So a = 17.
Define each Buns 's Pickles as C; So C = 2.
Define each Buns 's Gelatin as l; So l = 13.
Define each Half-and-half 's Gelatin as U; So U = C - a = 2 - 17 = 8.
Define each Half-and-half 's Ingredient as X; So X = U + a = 8 + 17 = 2.
Define each Vons 's Half-and-half as i; So i = 7 * C = 7 * 2 = 14.
Define each Buns 's Ingredient as P; So P = l + C = 13 + 2 = 15.
Define each Vons 's Buns as j; So j = C - X = 2 - 2 = 0.
Define each Vons 's Ingredient as M; h = P * j = 15 * 0 = 0; T = X * i = 2 * 14 = 5; So M = h + T = 0 + 5 = 5.
